agreement.standardized_definition: A set of legally binding rights and obligations between two or more legal entities.

agreement_term.standardized_definition: Legally enforceable condition set forth within the bounds of an agreement.

brand.standardized_definition: A name, symbol, or design that identifies and differentiates products, offerings, or organizational identities.

business_entity.standardized_definition: A legal body or bodies that comprises or comprise a single organization.

campaign.standardized_definition: An outreach activity that targets a specific population, for example, customers, human resources, partners, and patients, to achieve a certain goal, such as marketing awareness, hiring activities, and health awareness.

channel.standardized_definition: A digital, analog, or physical conduit through which products, related services, or communications are delivered or received, including the Internet, phone, delivery service, satellite, radio, or physical means.

competency.standardized_definition: The skills and knowledge necessary to do something.

content.standardized_definition: A creative work, such as is manifested in audio/visual, still image, textual, experiential, mixed-media, or other forms.

customer.standardized_definition: A legal entity that has, plans to have, or has had an agreement with the organization, or is a recipient or beneficiary of the organization's products or services.

decision.standardized_definition: A conclusion or resolution reached after considering alternative options.

event.standardized_definition: An occurrence that has happened or may happen, especially one of importance, concern, or interest.

facility.standardized_definition: A physical structure at a given place where business is conducted.

currency.standardized_definition: An agreed medium of value exchange.

financial_account.standardized_definition: A named container of monetary value transactions that are typically organized into assets, liabilities, income, expense, equity, and other related categories.

financial_forecast.standardized_definition: A prediction of a future financial aspect of the organization.

financial_transaction.standardized_definition: An instance of a monetary amount movement or related exchange across businesses, agreements, or financial accounts.

monetary_amount.standardized_definition: A representation of value as expressed in a given currency.

payment.standardized_definition: An obligation to remit or receive a monetary amount between an organization and a customer, partner, or other external party.

tax.standardized_definition: A compulsory contribution of monetary value to governing bodies.

human_resource.standardized_definition: An individual who has, plans to have, or has had a legal agreement with the organization, which includes compensation and other benefits, on a temporary or permanent basis.

incident.standardized_definition: An unplanned, disruptive, or potentially disruptive, experience.

initiative.standardized_definition: A coordinated collection of temporary endeavors undertaken to create a unique outcome.

inquiry.standardized_definition: A question, request, feedback, or comment that may exist inside or outside of the business, which can be received, identified, harvested, disseminated, classified, and tracked.

intellectual_property_rights.standardized_definition: Legal protections, such as patents, trademarks, and copyrights.

interaction.standardized_definition: A set of contemporaneous collaborations or contacts about a given subject, over a span of time, between two or more entities, using one or more channels, at one or more physical or virtual locations such as meetings, interviews, seminars, or consultations.

investment_portfolio.standardized_definition: A set of resources expected to increase in value or provide income.

job.standardized_definition: A named category of accountabilities, whether remunerative or non-remunerative, associated with an assigned, specific, and accountable business duty, role, or function that can be executed by a human or non-human resource.

language.standardized_definition: A method of communication or dialect variant consisting of units of representation or meaning, such as numbers, words, symbols, sounds, or other physical manifestations and gestures, presented in a structured way.

legal_proceeding.standardized_definition: An activity invoking the power of a tribunal to enforce a law.

market.standardized_definition: Individuals, populations of individuals, or organizations constituting the demand for existing or future products and services.

message.standardized_definition: A verbal, written, recorded, or digitally-represented communication, including missives, notifications, alerts, and other internally or externally targeted communication about the organization's mission, products, plans, activities, and other focal points.

order.standardized_definition: A request by one party to another to buy, sell, or exchange goods or services.

partner.standardized_definition: A legal entity that has, plans to have, or has had some degree of involvement with the organization.

plan.standardized_definition: A set of related activities to achieve a result.

policy.standardized_definition: A course or principle of action adopted or proposed by an organization.

product.standardized_definition: A named combination of goods and services that can be offered to customers, in whole or in part.

research.standardized_definition: A systematic investigation into materials and sources.

schedule_element.standardized_definition: A line item that aligns time and one or more other objects, including work item, human resource, payment, event, and location.

strategy.standardized_definition: An integrated pattern and perspective that aligns an organization’s goals, objectives, and action sequences into a cohesive whole.

action_item.standardized_definition: A specific course to be taken to achieve an objective.

goal.standardized_definition: An end toward which effort is or should be directed.

objective.standardized_definition: A quantitative, measurable result that defines strategy.

vision.standardized_definition: An imagined future state of being.

submission.standardized_definition: A container that is used to exchange one or more requests, inquiries, messages, notifications, or other content between parties.

time.standardized_definition: A point or duration in the past, present, or future.

training_course.standardized_definition: The structured theoretical or practical subject matter in a consumable format, associated with a curriculum, workshop, or seminar.

work_item.standardized_definition: A defined, well-bounded task that may be assigned to a stakeholder or corresponding asset.

work_queue.standardized_definition: A container to hold, sequence, filter, structure, and present a set of work items.

geographic_space.standardized_definition: A physical area across land, air, and water, in order to provide for the well-being of, and enable or restrict access to, that space as needed to meet economic, environmental, security, health, recreational, and other needs that arise.

geographic_border.standardized_definition: A line of demarcation around a geographic space or between one geographic space and another geographic space.

geographic_space_cadaster.standardized_definition: A geometric description of area parcels, extent, value, ownership, tenure, rights, restrictions, and responsibilities associated with a property area or space.

investment.standardized_definition: Any type of monetary asset purchased with the idea that the asset will provide income in the future or will be sold at a higher price for a profit.

conveyor.standardized_definition: Any variety of an apparatus, whether human- or robot-piloted, that has the capacity to transport people, animals, goods, assets, or other physical items, and includes, but is not limited to trucks, carts, automobiles, rail-based vehicles and assemblies, air-borne craft, water-borne craft, animal-pulled devices, and animal-assemblies.

infrastructure.standardized_definition: A physical structure or facility, which may include, for example, a building, station, bridge, tunnel, rail corridor, or roadway.

material.standardized_definition: Physical matter used in the construction and maintenance of assets and infrastructure, and the powering of physical products and conveyors.

network.standardized_definition: A set of connected arcs and nodes that may be associated with a system of infrastructure, assets, locations, routes, and other business objects.

network_arc.standardized_definition: A connection or association between nodes in a network.

network_node.standardized_definition: A connection point in a network.

operation.standardized_definition: An orchestration of work to achieve a specific objective constrained by time and location that include, for example, flight turnaround, package sorting, loading/unloading, boarding, and service centers.

route.standardized_definition: A way or course taken in getting from a starting point to a destination, which may include stops along the way.

shipment.standardized_definition: Freight, cargo, baggage, or packages containing a wide range of inanimate or non-human living contents.

shipment_item.standardized_definition: A single unit of freight, cargo, baggage, or package that is part of an overall shipment.

trip.standardized_definition: A journey between a starting point location and one or more targeted locations, until a final destination is reached.

meeting.standardized_definition: A gathering of two or more persons at a determinable time and place, including physical and virtual engagements, conferences, or related gatherings.

accreditation.standardized_definition: An endorsement by a duly recognized and acknowledged third party that indicates ability, competence, knowledge, provenance, or quality.

dispute.standardized_definition: An official argument or disagreement among interested parties.

energy.standardized_definition: Sources of power, such as but not limited to, those derived from the utilization of physical or chemical resources, especially to provide light and heat and to work devices and machines.

financial_position.standardized_definition: A consolidated and holistic representation of actual financial standing or activity for a point in time or duration.

order_item.standardized_definition: An order element that refers to a specific good or service.

product_forecast.standardized_definition: An estimate, prediction, or projection for period of time for a given product.

course_of_action.standardized_definition: A set of activities to be taken to achieve an objective.

beneficiary.standardized_definition: A legal entity that has, plans to have, or has had an agreement with the organization, or is a recipient of or derives an advantage from the organization's products or services.

biological_organism.standardized_definition: Non-human living things, including all categories of animals, plants, and microorganisms that are part of the earth's ecosystem, react to stimuli, consume natural resources to grow, thrive, reproduce, and can affect the well-being of beneficiaries.

evidence.standardized_definition: A supported body of facts, upon which to base proof, or establish truth or falsehood, in accordance with rules, such as for privacy or preservation.

financial_instrument.standardized_definition: A tradeable asset, such as stocks, bonds, bills of exchange, futures, options, evidence of ownership, and cash.

health_condition.standardized_definition: A physical or mental disorder, disease, illness, injury, impairment, state, medical disabilities, or non-medical disabilities, that may permanently or temporarily affect and can be associated with living things including human beings and other biological organisms.

natural_resource.standardized_definition: Matter that can occur in nature.

standard.standardized_definition: A defined convention, specification, or measurement, as confirmed by a recognized governance body.

vote.standardized_definition: A formal indication of choice such as for a candidate election, referendum, or proposition.

claim.standardized_definition: A demand or request to indemnify a customer or the provider of services under the terms of an agreement.

device.standardized_definition: A machine, contrivance, implant, or in vitro reagent that is recognized, identifiable, and cataloged as an approach to reduce the likelihood of a claim, or mitigate the outcomes of a claim.

case.standardized_definition: A plan of action to, act on, report on, resolve, or otherwise address an instance of a need or demand that requires resolution, such as in the context of legal, ongoing healthcare, or claim.

cadaster.standardized_definition: A geometric description of area parcels, extent, value, ownership, tenure, rights, restrictions, and responsibilities associated with a property area or space.

constituent.standardized_definition: An individual or entity relative to an organization's sphere of responsibility.

government_service.standardized_definition: A named combination of goods, doing-of-work-for-others, and entitlements that can be offered to constituents.

legislation.standardized_definition: A set of authoritative directives that include laws or related statutory instruments.

license.standardized_definition: An authorization to perform a regulated activity, awarded by duly recognized governmental agency or third party, applied to an individual or organization, to engage in an activity, such as fishing, or use of regulated objects, such as modes of transportation or hazardous materials.

license_term.standardized_definition: A legally enforceable condition set forth within the bounds of a license.

public_sector_entity.standardized_definition: A governmental body or collection of governmental bodies.

collateral.standardized_definition: Property or other asset that a customer offers as security to a borrowing or lending agreement.
